com.cube.storm

Class MessageSettings.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cube.storm.MessageSettings.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    MessageSettings

    public static class MessageSettings.Builder
extends Object
    The builder class for MessageSettings. Use this to create a new MessageSettings instance with the customised properties specific for your project. Call build() to build the settings object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageSettings.Builder(Context context)
      Default constructor

      • messageReceiver

        public MessageSettings.Builder messageReceiver(MessageReceiver receiver)
        Sets the receiver for the module. You must also set this in your manifest for the framework to use correctly. 

         <receiver
         android:name="com.cube.storm.message.lib.receiver.MessageReceiver"
         android:permission="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.SEND"
 >
         <intent-filter>
                <action android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE" />
                <category android:name="com.cube.storm.example" />
         </intent-filter>
 </receiver>
        Parameters:
        receiver - The receiver to use
        Returns:
        The builder to allow for chaining

      • build

        public MessageSettings build()
        Builds the final settings object and sets its instance. Use MessageSettings.getInstance() to retrieve the settings instance.

        This method will also register the receiver to the given context in #Builder(android.content.Context) if the receiver is not null.

        Returns:
        The newly set MessageSettings instance
